sense-walls-multisystem.visionLevel.name: Piercing Vision Level
sense-walls-multisystem.visionLevel.desc: The minimum level of vision required to ignore this wall. A setting of None (default) cannot be pierced by any level of vision, like a default wall.
This sense is used from the module 'Sense Walls Multisystem'
This sense is used from the module 'Sense Walls Multisystem'
sense-walls-multisystem.effects.none.des: This sense is used from the module 'Sense Walls Multisystem'
This sense is used from the module 'Sense Walls Multisystem'
sense-walls-multisystem.effects.normal.d: This sense is used from the module 'Sense Walls Multisystem'
This sense is used from the module 'Sense Walls Multisystem'
A blinded creature can’t see and automatically fails any ability check that requires sight.
Attack rolls against the creature have advantage, and the creature’s attack rolls have disadvantage.

A blinded creature can’t see and automatically fails any ability check that requires sight.
Attack rolls against the creature have advantage, and the creature’s attack rolls have disadvantage.
sense-walls-multisystem.effects.darkvisi: A monster with Darkvision can see in the dark within a specific radius. The monster can see in dim light within the radius as if it were bright light, and in Darkness as if it were dim light. The monster can’t discern color in Darkness, only Shades of Gray. Many Creatures that live Underground have this Special sense.

A monster with Darkvision can see in the dark within a radius of {number}. The monster can see in dim light within the radius as if it were bright light, and in Darkness as if it were dim light. The monster can’t discern color in Darkness, only Shades of Gray. Many Creatures that live Underground have this Special sense.
sense-walls-multisystem.effects.tremorse: A monster with tremorsense can detect and pinpoint the origin of vibrations within a specific radius, provided that the monster and the source of the vibrations are in contact with the same ground or substance. Tremorsense can't be used to detect flying or incorporeal creatures. Many burrowing creatures, such as ankhegs and umber hulks, have this special sense.

A monster with tremorsense can detect and pinpoint the origin of vibrations within a radius of {number}, provided that the monster and the source of the vibrations are in contact with the same ground or substance. Tremorsense can't be used to detect flying or incorporeal creatures. Many burrowing creatures, such as ankhegs and umber hulks, have this special sense.
sense-walls-multisystem.effects.seeinvis: For the duration, you see invisible creatures and objects as if they were visible, and you can see into the Ethereal Plane. Ethereal creatures and objects appear ghostly and translucent.

For the duration, you see invisible creatures and objects as if they were visible within a radius of {number}, and you can see into the Ethereal Plane. Ethereal creatures and objects appear ghostly and translucent.
sense-walls-multisystem.effects.blindsig:
A monster with blindsight can perceive its surroundings without relying on sight, within a specific radius.
Creatures without eyes, such as grimlocks and gray oozes, typically have this special sense, as do creatures with echolocation or heightened senses, such as bats and true dragons.
If a monster is naturally blind, it has a parenthetical note to this effect, indicating that the radius of its blindsight defines the maximum range of its perception.

A monster with blindsight can perceive its surroundings without relying on sight, within a radius of {number}.
Creatures without eyes, such as grimlocks and gray oozes, typically have this special sense, as do creatures with echolocation or heightened senses, such as bats and true dragons.
If a monster is naturally blind, it has a parenthetical note to this effect, indicating that the radius of its blindsight defines the maximum range of its perception.
sense-walls-multisystem.effects.truesigh: A monster with truesight can, out to a specific range, see in normal and magical darkness, see invisible creatures and objects, automatically detect visual illusions and succeed on saving throws against them, and perceive the original form of a shapechanger or a creature that is transformed by magic. Furthermore, the monster can see into the Ethereal Plane within the same range.

Within a radius of {number} a monster with truesight can, out to a specific range, see in normal and magical darkness, see invisible creatures and objects, automatically detect visual illusions and succeed on saving throws against them, and perceive the original form of a shapechanger or a creature that is transformed by magic. Furthermore, the monster can see into the Ethereal Plane within the same range.
sense-walls-multisystem.effects.devilssi: You can see normally in darkness, both magical and nonmagical, to a certain distance.
You can see normally in darkness, both magical and nonmagical, to a distance of {number}.
sense-walls-multisystem.effects.lowlight: A creature with low-light vision can see in dim light as though it were bright light, so it ignores the concealed condition due to dim light.
Within a radius of {number} a creature with low-light vision can see in dim light as though it were bright light, so it ignores the concealed condition due to dim light.
sense-walls-multisystem.effects.greaterd: A creature with darkvision or greater darkvision can see perfectly well in areas of darkness and dim light, though such vision is in black and white only. Some forms of magical darkness, such as a 4th-level darkness spell, block normal darkvision. A creature with greater darkvision, however, can see through even these forms of magical darkness.

Within a radius of {number} a creature with darkvision or greater darkvision can see perfectly well in areas of darkness and dim light, though such vision is in black and white only. Some forms of magical darkness, such as a 4th-level darkness spell, block normal darkvision. A creature with greater darkvision, however, can see through even these forms of magical darkness.
sense-walls-multisystem.setting.disableO: If enable it will disable the override draw on wall for avoid collision with other module
sense-walls-multisystem.dialogs.nosystem:
This system is not currently fully supported. This means that the module does not know how to best handle this system's items, but can still operate in a limited fashion.

You can configure the module's settings yourself, but it requires a bit of technical know-how.

If you have any questions, ping Wasp#2005 on the Foundry discord.
sense-walls-multisystem.dialogs.systemfo:
This system was previously not supported, but in an recent update it was added as a supported system!

Do you want to load this system's default Item Pile settings?
sense-walls-multisystem.setting.reset.hi: This will reset all of the settings of back to the active game system's default.
sense-walls-multisystem.setting.debug.la: Prints debug messages to the console
sense-walls-multisystem.dialogs.resetset: Are you sure you want to reset all of the module settings to the current system's defaults? THIS CANNOT BE UNDONE!
